brief_summary.textblock:
People swimming or surfing in lake Kineret , sometimes complain of nasal stuffiness ,
      sneezing and  itching .Typically, it happens   during or immediately after contact with the
      lake`s water . The symptoms are compatible with immediate allergic reaction. Previous
      reports suggested a connection between similar symptoms and contact with different
      cyanobacteria (living in fresh water lakes). In this study we intend to prove the mechanism
      of these reactions.  To prove the exact allergen that causes allergic rhinitis allergists
      perform skin tests with different suspected allergens. Likewise, we would like to perform
      skin tests to different proteins extracted from cyanobacteria collected in lake Kineret.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age above 18

          -  exposed to Lake Keneret water by swiming or sirfing

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age under 18

          -  pregnancy

intervention.description: Skin test with sterile extracts of different cyanobacteria is performed on the volar aspect of the forearm. Typically, the results are read 15 minutes after performing the test. Test is regarded as positive when wheal of more than 3mm and flare appear within this time frame. Positive test indicates the existence of specific IgE to the extract in on skin mast cells .
intervention.intervention_name: Skin test with sterile extracts of different cyanobacteria

primary_outcome.measure: Reproducibility of  skin test to cyanobacteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after performing the test (15 minutes)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
